survey.description: First inventory of the Kingdom of Archenland (1015-1020)

version.label: BP 1.3.1015
version.description: Original forms used during pilot and for most of first year

version.label: BP 6.11.1015 - SE 25.2.1015
version.description: Added crown density measurements measured at five points and soil table added.

item.label: Planned
item.description: Planned as part of original sampling design

item.label: Quality assurance
item.description: Revisiting plots for quality assurance

item.label: Unplanned
item.description: Additional plots not included in original sampling design

item.label: Accessible
item.description: Topographic and road or river network make it possible to reach the site

item.label: Inaccessible - slope
item.description: Very steep hill making the field work dangerous

item.label: Inaccessible - owner refusal
item.description: Owner does not allow one to enter the site either by fencing or by not giving permission

item.label: Inaccessible - restricted area
item.description: E.g. military areas, border areas, land mines areas

item.label: Inaccessible - water body
item.description: Water body does not allow to sample or reach the site

item.label: Inaccessible - other reason
item.description: Specify in remarks

item.label: Production forest
item.description: Land designated for production and extraction of products (wood, fibre, bio-energy and/or non-wood forest products). Includes concessions, exploitation licenses, community forests etc.

item.label: Protection forest
item.description: Protected forest lands. Including also nature reserves, soil conservation, water and watershed protection, protection against erosion and landslides.

item.label: Wildlife reserve
item.description: National parks, game reserves, game controlled areas etc

item.label: Agriculture
item.description: Incl. agro-forestry

item.label: Built-up areas
item.description: Urban or rural, or mixed. Including roads, buildings, ower lines, etc.

item.label: Water body or swamp
item.description: Seasonal, Permanent or Swamp

item.label: Other land
item.description: To be specified in Remarks

item.label: Central government land
item.description: Owned by central government, or by government-owned institutions or corporations

item.label: Local government land
item.description: Owned by local government (district)

item.label: Village land
item.description: Owned by a collective, a group of co-owners, or a community who hold exclusive rights and share duties

item.label: Private land
item.description: Owned by private enterprises, industries, individuals or families, private co-operatives, corporations, religious and educational institutions, pension or investment funds, NGOs, nature conservation societies or other private institutions

item.label: General land
item.description: Public land that does not belong to any of the above categories

item.label: Not known
item.description: No information available on the land ownership

item.label: Other vegetation
item.description: To be specified in Remarks

item.label: No damage
item.description: Naturally open area, or normal tree vegetation where might be some individual trees damaged by insects, fungus or other reason but otherwise forest is in good condition

item.label: Fire
item.description: Disturbance caused by fire

item.label: Insects, fungus or diseases
item.description: Disturbance caused by insect pests or by fungus. Disturbance caused by diseases attributable to pathogens, such as bacteria, fungi, phytoplasma or virus.

item.label: Other biotic agents
item.description: Disturbance caused by biotic agents other than insects or diseases, such as wildlife browsing, grazing, physical damage by animals, etc. Specify in Remarks.

item.label: Wind or other abiotic factor
item.description: Disturbances caused by abiotic factors, such as storm, drought, air pollution, etc. Specify in Remarks.

item.label: Human activities
item.description: Cuttings, firewood collecting, debarking, other human-made damages

item.label: None
item.description: No damages

item.label: Slight
item.description: Evidences of damages are visible, but not causing long-term damages. Only few trees are affected

item.label: Serious
item.description: Damages are clearly visible, probably causing long-term damages or loss of growth. Several trees are affected

item.label: Very serious
item.description: Damage is finally causing wide mortality of trees, or hinders them growing. Mortality is likely to remain high for a long time

item.label: No soil
item.description: E.g. built-up area, water

item.label: Sand
item.description: Soil having mostly sand particles. A wet sample does not stain hands.

item.label: Loamy sand
item.description: Soil in which sand particles are predominant but also containing silt. Slightly sticky, but no ribbons can be formed.

item.label: Sandy loam + Sandy clay loam + Sandy clay
item.description: Makes a sound, when rubbed between the fingers close to the ear. Allows to be formed into a stick of cigarette size.

item.label: Loam
item.description: Soil having mostly silt and with some clay. Only a relatively thick ribbon can be formed which will break soon after formation from its own weight. Rubbing between fingers makes a very light sound only.

item.label: Clay loam
item.description: Soil having higher percentage of clay loam particles but also having some sand and silt. Forms a thin ribbon which will readily break from its own weight when about 2-4 cm long. No sound when rubbed between fingers.

item.label: Clay
item.description: Soil contains mostly clay particles. Highly plastic and slippery when handled. Allows to be formed into a thin string.

item.label: Silt + Silt loam + Silty clay loam + Silty clay
item.description: Substrate particles smaller than sand and larger than clay. Silt is easily transported in water or other liquids and is fine enough to be carried long distances by air as 'dust'

item.label: Other
item.description: To be specified in Remarks

item.label: Granular
item.description: If the topsoil is granular, the water enters easily and the seed germination is possible.

item.label: Blocky
item.description: Blocky soil looks like irregularly-shaped blocks. Movement of the water is moderate.

item.label: Prismatic
item.description: Movement of the water in the soil is predominantly vertical and therefore the supply of water to the plant roots is usually poor.

item.label: Platy
item.description: When present in the topsoil, a platy structure blocks the entrance of water; seed germination is difficult due to poor aeration.

item.label: Massive
item.description: Soil particles occur in solid masses and do not break aprt easily under light pressure. This structure blocks the entrance of water and seed germination is difficult due to poor aeration associated with very finely textured soils, like clay.

item.label: Single grain
item.description: Soil particles exist as individual soil grains that do not stick together and generally remain loosely-packed. This structure is found in sandy soils.

item.label: No erosion
item.description: No evidence of soil erosion

item.label: Light erosion
item.description: Slight erosion where only surface erosion has taken place.

item.label: Moderate erosion
item.description: Where mild gullies and rills are formed on the top surface of the soil.

item.label: Heavy erosion
item.description: Areas which have deep guillies, ravines, land slips etc.

item.label: No grazing
item.description: There is no evidence of grazing

item.label: Occasional
item.description: Only choice plants and areas show use. There is no use of poor forage plants

item.label: Frequent
item.description: Most range shows use. 1/3 – 2/3 of primary forage plants showing use

item.label: Extensive
item.description: Lands can be severely hedged. There is evidence of life-stock trailing to forage. More than 2/3 of primary forage plants showing use

item.label: Bare land
item.description: No water catchment value

item.label: Low
item.description: The area has vegetation but it is not a particular source of water

item.label: Medium
item.description: Seasonal rivers providing water to lower land areas

item.label: High
item.description: Area contains lakes, ponds, rivers, or it is a forest land which collects/feeds water to lower land areas

item.label: No impact
item.description: No cutting or other impact, or the cutting has happened more than 5 years ago

item.label: Clear felling
item.description: Removal of all trees has been carried out. The generation of forest is done by planting, seeding or coppicing.

item.label: Silvicultural treatment
item.description: e.g. pruning, planting, climber cutting, weeding, boundary clearing, fire line construction

item.label: Medicinal activities
item.description: Collecting of medicinal plants (e.g. leaves, bark, roots) used in traditional medicine and/or for pharmaceutical companies

item.label: Land-use change (from forest, woodland or bushland)
item.description: Specify previous Land use class in Remarks

item.label: Afforestation
item.description: Establishment of forest through planting and/or deliberate seeding on land that, until then, was not classified as forest. Implies a transformation of land use from non-forest to forest. Specify previous Land use type in Remarks

item.label: Mining, Sand collection
item.description: Mining and land extraction activities

item.label: Other
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Fruits, nuts, seeds, roots, berries, etc
item.description: Vegetable foodstuffs and beverages provided by fruits, nuts, seeds, roots, etc.

item.label: Mushrooms
item.description: Foodstuffs provided by mushrooms.

item.label: Fodder
item.description: Animal and bee fodder provided by leaves, fruits, etc

item.label: Plant medicines
item.description: Medicinal plants (e.g. leaves, bark, roots) used in traditional medicine and/or for pharmaceutical companies.

item.label: Dying / tanning
item.description: Plant material (bark and leaves) providing tannins and other plant parts (especially leaves and fruits) used as colorants.

item.label: Other plant products
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Wildlife
item.description: Provides habitat for wildlife

item.label: Windbreaks
item.description: Acts as a windbreaker

item.label: Shade
item.description: Provides shade

item.label: Aesthetic
item.description: Provides landscape beauty

item.label: Recreation and tourism potential
item.description: Including ecotourism, hunting or fishing as leisure activity. Unique feature.

item.label: Cultural heritage potential
item.description: Including religious / spiritual potential

item.label: Other
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Thinning
item.description: In the case of plantation

item.label: Silvicultural treatment
item.description: e.g. pruning, planting, climber cutting, weeding, boundary clearing, fire line construction

item.label: Change status
item.description: E.g. productive to protective or vice versa. Explain in Remarks.

item.label: Big mammals
item.description: Lion, elephant, rhino, etc

item.label: Rare biotope
item.description: e.g. spring, oasis
Sparse shrub canopy cover
Very open shrub canopy cover
Open shrub canopy cover
Closed shrub canopy cover

item.label: Healthy tree (Default)
item.description: A tree is healthy when it does not show symptoms of disease or other that have any substantial effect on the tree’s growth and vitality.

item.label: Diseased tree
item.description: A tree is affected when it shows symptoms of disease or attack by insects that affect the tree’s growth and vitality.

item.label: Affected by Ficus sp.
item.description: Ficus which may eventually destroy its host.

item.label: Other damage agent
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Dead tree
item.description: Dead standing tree. Laying dead tree data is recorded on Dead Wood Form.

item.label: Fully or partially rotten wood material
Owner
item.description: Owner of a plot or part of a plot within the SU

item.label: Employee
item.description: Person working in the SU

item.label: Manager of the site
item.description: Person responsible for natural resources management in the SU

item.label: Settler
item.description: Person living in the SU or user from sorroundings

item.label: Internal key informant
item.description: Individual living inside the area, but with in-depth knowledge of the local settings, use of land and natural resources

item.label: External key informant
item.description: Individual living outside the area, but with particular knowledge about the site, the land/natural resource use and the local community (e.g. local government officials, leaders of local organizations...)

item.label: Private owner dictates the conditions for access and use
Local community norms and customs (no formal rules)
Local community rules/bylaws (formal rules, often written down)
Not applicable
item.description: No inhabitants in the site of surroundings

item.label: Decreasing
item.description: The population living in the site decreased during the last 5 years

item.label: Stable
item.description: The number of people living in the site remained stable during the last 5 years

item.label: Increasing
item.description: The population living in the site increased during the last 5 years

item.label: Not known
item.description: There is not enough information to estimate this trend

list.name: settlement_history
list.label: Settlement history
list.description: Major historical events that have affected the local people and land use in the area

item.label: Not applicable
item.description: No inhabitants in the SU or surroundings

item.label: None
item.description: There are currently no management plans for any area of the SU

item.label: Formal
item.description: Formal management plan formulated and implemented

item.label: Traditional
item.description: No formal management plan formulated or formal management plan formulated but not implemented

item.label: Owner is the exclusive manager
item.description: The owner retains management rights and responabilities within the limits specified by the legislation

item.label: Joint management with communities
item.description: Management decisions remain with the owner and the management activities are executed by local communities (including indigenous and tribal communities), according to an agreement. The agreement allocates temporary exploitation rights for specific products or activities. Are included lands allocated for exctration porposes through licences or concessions

item.label: Joint management with private companies/private sectors
item.description: Management decisions remain with the owner and the management activities are executed by private companies, according to an agreement. The agreement allocates temporary exploitation rights for porposes through licences or concessions

item.label: Community managed, owner not involved in management
item.description: The owner devolves land management to the local communities (including indigenous and tribal communities), according to leases or management agreement

item.label: Managed by private sector, owner not involved in management
item.description: The owner devolves land management to the private companies/private sector/individuals, according to leases or management agreement, including rental

item.label: Not known
item.description: There is not enough information to obtain management agreement

item.label: Other
item.description: To be specified in notes

list.name: law_enforcement_likelihood
list.label: Likelihood illegal activities stopped or detected

item.label: Field interview
item.description: Field interview completed

item.label: Questionnaire checked
item.description: Checking questionnaire

item.label: Data entry
item.description: Entering data into database

item.label: Data cleaned
item.description: Checking and approving data entry

item.label: Food grown on land owned and cultivated by household
Food grown on land cultivated but not owned by household (e.g. land rented)
Food from forest (mushroom, fruits, bushmeat, etc.)
Food given as gift or food aid
Harvest more wild foods not found in forest
Assistance from NGO, community/religious organization or similar
Loan from money lender, credit associations, bank, etc.

list.name: forest_disturbance_response
list.label: Forest disturbance response
list.description: Response to major disturbances in local forests decreasing forest product availability

item.label: By harvesting more of other forest products
By harvesting from a different forest
Forest: Humid Montane
item.description: Catchment forest, > 800 m asl

item.label: Forest: Lowland
item.description: Groundwater forests, some coastal forests, < 800 m asl.

item.label: Forest: Mangrove
item.description: Area of forest and other wooded land with mangrove vegetation.

item.label: Forest: Plantation
item.description: Note: Detect Planting year in Plot data

item.label: Woodland: Closed (>40%)
item.description: Beekeeping, Hunting, Recreation, Grazing, Conservation, Timber production

item.label: Woodland: Scattered cropland (Unspecified density)
item.description: Shifting cultivation

item.label: Bushland: Thicket
item.description: below 5 m

item.label: Bushland: Dense
item.description: Grazing

item.label: Bushland: Scattered cultivation
item.description: Shifting cultivation

item.label: Bushland: Open
item.description: Hunting, Recreation, Grazing

item.label: Grassland: Wooded
item.description: Hunting, Recreation, Grazing

item.label: Grassland: Scattered cropland
item.description: Cultivation

item.label: Grassland: Open
item.description: Hunting, Recreation, Grazing

item.label: Cultivated land: Agro-forestry system
item.description: Chagga home gardens with timber and fruit trees shading coffee, banana, beans, yams

item.label: Cultivated land: Wooded crops
item.description: Monocultures of tea, cashewnuts, cloves, coffee

item.label: Cultivated land: Herbaceous crops
item.description: Maize, wheat, rice, bananas, cotton, sisal

item.label: Cultivated land: Mixed tree cropping
item.description: Fruit (coconut, mango, orange), cashew, grain vegetables

item.label: Cultivated land: Grain crops
item.description: Various types of grass crops e.g., maize, wheat, millet, rice, sorghum.

item.label: Open land: Salt crusts
item.description: Mining for salt

item.label: Open land: Rock outcrops
item.description: Recreation

item.label: Water: Inland water
item.description: Lake, river, seasonal water body

item.label: Other areas
item.description: Urban and rural build-up areas, air fields, infrastructure (powerlines, railways, mining sites)

item.label: Serious illness or disability in family
Between 2 and 5 km from the HH
Not Applicable
item.description: Timber, beams, poles for construction, etc

item.label: Decreasing
item.description: When quantity harvested has decreased

item.label: No Change
item.description: When the quantity harvested has not changed

item.label: Increasing
item.description: When quantity harvested has increased

list.name: harvest_rights
list.label: Harvest rights
list.description: User rights to harvest the product

item.label: No
item.description: No local rules exist that regulate use of product

item.label: Not applicable
item.description: No payment was received from anybody

item.label: Central Government
item.description: Central government office and its agencies

item.label: NGOs
item.description: Non-governmental Organization

item.label: Individual
item.description: An individual has paid for the environmental service, i.e. tourists paying a visitor's fee

item.label: Local community group that made the rules
Accomodating with follow up action, to solve problem
The solving of the conflict is still ongoing
Knowledge of activities in the area
Share is much lower than it should be
Share is somewhat lower than it should be
Share is somewhat higher than it should be
Share is much higher than it should be

entity.name: time_study
entity.label: Time study
entity.description: Date, start time and end time of visit to the cluster.

pattern.message: Subplot letter must be a single letter (A-Z)
Must correspond to colour codes indicated in Munsell Soil Colour Book in the form hue/value/chroma.

code.name: stones
code.label: Stones
code.prompt: Proportion of stones

entity.name: shrubs
entity.label: Shrub
Shrubs
entity.description: Inside the plot (within 15 m of plot centre)

number.name: count
number.label: Count
number.description: Number of seedlings and saplings >10cm tall and with DBH<1cm

number.name: dbh
number.label: DBH (cm)
number.description: Diameter at the breast height (1.3 m) measured above bark

check.message: Unusual relationship between DBH and total height.
Unusual relationship between dbh and total height.

number.name: approx_year
number.label: Years ago
number.description: Number of years ago when tree was felled. If year is missing, it is assumed that the tree well felled more than three years ago.

code.name: role
code.label: Informant role(s)
code.prompt: Who is the Informant?

number.name: household_count
number.label: Nearby households
number.prompt: What is the total number of households that reside within boundaries of 2km sampling unit?

code.name: population_health
code.label: Health condition
code.prompt: Compared to the rest of the population in the district, how would you characterize the general health condition of the population living near and inside the Sampling Unit?

text.name: product
text.label: Most important product(s) harvested
text.prompt: Which are the three most important products that most local people harvest from this area (refer to area within SU-- point to 2km circle on map/image)?

number.name: beneficiary_household_count
number.label: Harvesting households
number.prompt: Approximately how many households (regardless of where they live) regularly harvest products from this particular area (refer to area within SU-- point to 2km circle on map/image)?

boolean.name: rules_exist
boolean.label: Product use rules
boolean.prompt: Are there any rules (informal or formal) that constrain local households' uses of products?

code.name: rule_origin
code.label: Origin(s) of rules
code.prompt: If yes, what is the origin of these rules?

code.name: settlement_est
code.label: Settlement established
code.prompt: When was this settlement established (when did the local household dwellings arrive to the area)?

code.name: population_change
code.label: Population trend
code.prompt: What is the population trend for the past 5 years for this area?

code.name: major_event
code.label: Major historical event(s)
code.prompt: What are some of the major historical events that have affected local people and their land use in this area?

boolean.name: mgmt_exists
boolean.label: Forest management efforts
boolean.prompt: Have there been any efforts to manage or somehow organize the forest resource use within this area?

entity.name: mgmt_gender_composition
entity.label: Forest management gender composition
entity.prompt: If yes, what is the gender composition of the group?

check.message: Male and female gender compositions should add up to 100%

code.name: mgmt_leader
code.label: Management effort leader
code.prompt: If yes, was there a particular leader of this effort?

boolean.name: mgmt_ongoing
boolean.label: Management ongoing
boolean.prompt: Is this effort still ongoing?

code.name: mgmt_success
code.label: Management success
code.prompt: In your opinion, would you consider the efforts to manage and order forest use in this area to have been successful?

code.name: mgmt_plan
code.label: Active management plan
code.prompt: Does this area have an active forest management plan?

code.name: mgmt_agreement
code.label: Management arrangement
code.prompt: Which management arrangement exist between the land owner and other groups?

code.name: land_owner
code.label: 17b
Land owner
code.prompt: Who owns the land?

code.name: illegal_activity
code.label: Extent affected by illegal activities
code.prompt: To what extent is this particular area affected by large-scale, illegal forestry activities?

code.name: large_scale_law_enforcement
code.label: Large-scale illegal activity stopped
code.prompt: If a local person engages in large-scale illegal activities, (i.e. large timber operation, industrial charcoal making, etc) in this area, what is the likelihood of anybody detecting or stopping this activity?

code.name: small_scale_law_enforcement
code.label: Small-scale illegal activity stopped
code.prompt: If a local person engages in a small-scale illegal activities, (i.e. cutting of timber, charcoal making for local markets, etc), what is the likelihood of anybody detecting or stopping this activity?

boolean.name: local_forest_leadership_exists
boolean.label: Local forest leadership
boolean.prompt: Are there any local individuals who have shown leadership to organize forest activities among forest users in this area?

text.name: most_active_forest_org
text.label: Most active forest organization
text.prompt: Which is the most active forestry organization in this area? (write name)

number.name: org_nearest_office
number.label: Distance to nearest office
number.prompt: If applicable, how far away from this SU does this forestry organization (mentioned in Q22) have its nearest office?

number.name: household_member_count
number.label: Household members
number.prompt: How many members are there in this household (people who share meals on a daily basis)?

number.name: prev_household_member_count
number.label: Household members 5 years ago
number.prompt: How many members did this household have five years ago?

number.name: head_years_at_location
number.label: Head of household years at location
number.prompt: For how long has the head of this household lived in this location?

text.name: head_birthplace
text.label: Head of household birthplace
text.prompt: What is the birthplace of the head of the household? (name of district)

entity.name: head
entity.label: Head(s) of household
entity.prompt: Who are the heads of the household (head of household and spouse)?

code.name: education
code.label: Education
code.prompt: Education (highest level attained)

entity.name: house
entity.prompt: Describe the house in which this household lives (Enumerator’s observation)

code.name: wall_material
code.label: a
Wall material
code.prompt: What is the type of material of (most of) the walls?

code.name: roof_material
code.label: b
Roof material
code.prompt: What is the type of material of (most of) the roof?

entity.name: asset
entity.label: Assets
Asset
entity.prompt: Please indicate the number of the following items that are owned by the household:

entity.name: energy_source
entity.label: Main energy source
entity.prompt: Please indicate the household's main sources of energy and how they are acquired.

boolean.name: alt_energy_source_available
boolean.label: 3a
Alt. energy sources
boolean.prompt: Are there any alternatives to firewood/charcoal that are available here but not used?

entity.name: land_access
entity.label: Land access and ownership
entity.prompt: Please indicate the amount of land that you currently own and have access to:

code.name: boundaries_respected
code.label: Boundaries respected
code.prompt: Do outsiders respect boundaries?

code.name: boundaries_respected
code.label: Boundaries respected
code.prompt: Do outsiders respect boundaries?

entity.name: private_property_change
entity.label: Private property change
entity.prompt: Has the household's private land property changed over the last five years?

text.name: reasons
text.label: Reason(s)
text.prompt: Why did this change occur? (text to indicate source cause of change)

entity.name: food_source
entity.label: Food source
Food source(s)
entity.prompt: In the past year, where did the household’s food come from?

boolean.name: supplemental_nwfp_used
boolean.label: Supplemental NWFP used
boolean.prompt: During critical food shortage months does your household use forest products to meet food needs?

entity.name: supplemental_nwfp
entity.label: Supplemental NWFP
Supplemental NWFPs
entity.prompt: If yes, please indicate the forest products that are collected to supplement household food supplies during periods of food shortage:

Parcipation in Organizations and Forest User Groups

boolean.name: aware_of_pfm
boolean.label: Aware of PFM
boolean.prompt: Are you aware of any initiatives related to Participatory Forest Management?

boolean.name: aware_of_other
boolean.label: Other forest initiatives
boolean.prompt: Are there any other initiatives in this area that work on forest-related issues?

boolean.name: involvement
boolean.label: Involvement

text.name: names
text.label: Name(s) of group(s)
text.prompt: What is the name of the group(s) your household is involved with?

code.name: benefit_effects
code.label: Effects
code.prompt: Overall, how would you say the existence of the organization has affected the benefits that the household gets from the forest?

code.name: patrol_frequency
code.label: Patrol frequency
code.prompt: How frequently does the group/community that you belong to actively monitor and patrol the forests to detect intruders and thieves of forest products?

code.label: Gov't visit frequency
code.prompt: How frequently do government officials (district, region, central) visit the forest area?

code.label: Violators caught
code.prompt: In the past 12 months, approximately how many individuals have been caught breaking the established rules of forest use?

code.label: Punishment decider
code.prompt: Who decided which punishment these individuals should receive?

boolean.name: problems_experienced
boolean.label: Usage problems
boolean.prompt: In the past 12 months, have you experienced any problems relating to the use of land, water, forests or any other local natural resource?

boolean.name: assistance_requested
boolean.label: Assistance requested
boolean.prompt: If yes, have you asked any government representative (local or national) for assistance or help of any kind to help solve the problem?

code.name: assistance_response
code.label: Assistance response
code.prompt: If yes, what was the response?

boolean.name: conflict_experienced
boolean.label: Conflicts experienced
boolean.prompt: In the past 12 months, have you or your neighbours experienced any disputes or conflict related to the use of land, water, forests or any other local natural resource?

boolean.name: resolution_attempted
boolean.label: Resolution attempted
boolean.prompt: If yes, have you attempted to solve the conflict?

code.name: forum_used
code.label: Forum used
code.prompt: If yes, which forum did you use for solving conflict?

code.name: forum_effective
code.label: Forum effective
code.prompt: Was the forum effective in solving the conflict?

boolean.name: conflict_ongoing
boolean.label: Conflict ongoing
boolean.prompt: If no, does conflict still prevail?

code.name: first_contact
code.label: First contact
code.prompt: In case you or other community members detect a legal infraction by an outsider related to the use of land, water, forests or any other local natural resource, whom do you first contact?

code.label: Reason
code.prompt: Why?

boolean.label: Necessary
boolean.prompt: Has this been necessary during the last 12 months?
